page.title: 01General Description
page.content: Set in chalk downland,Stanbridge and Tilsworth are two small villages with a population of 827 and 358 respectively.To the south,beyond a disused railway lie Totternhoe Knolls with Maiden Bower and the hamlet of Sewell to the east. The old inn,The Five Bells o' Stanbridge,is situated beside an ancient village green with the church of St John the Baptist at the other end.Further along this road is the elementary school which serves Stanbridge and Tilsworth.In Tilsworth there is a moated manor house with stone gatehouse built during the War of the Roses.Opposite stands All Saints church on the highest point of the village. The Knolls at 160m above sea level provides the focal point of the area.
